page.title: 02TOURISM,SAUNDERSFOOT
page.content: Most people in the village are involved in the tourist trade as Saundersfoot has a beautiful coastline which attracts people from all over Britain. The visitors are accomodated in hotels e.g.St.Brides,and Rhodewood. Guest Houses include Malin House and Claremont. Private houses offer Bed and Breakfast.Caravan sites at The OLD MILL and Wiseman's Bridge.There are many self catering flats and houses. Visitors spend sunny days on the beach .There are other attractions to amuse them namely bowling and putting greens children's playground and lovely coastal walks.Beach attractions are Punch and Judy shows,Radio 1 shows,a trick cyclist and the Sunshine club. Wet days are spent in the amusement arcade, restaurants,public houses and drives to interesting places e.g.St. David's Cathedral and Pembroke Castle.
